channel.title: .jar File
channel.description: I am trying to make my own client, and I understand everything perfectly fine. But how would I make it into a WORKABLE .jar file? I use the batch file [code]java -Xmx512m -jar Client.jar 0 0 highmem members 0 pause [/code] from the downloadable version of Silab's client, since I don't know what java commands to use for that, anyways lol. Logical, realistic answers, please. :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 13, 2008, 06:14:10 am[/size][hr]Somebody has to have the answer.... :rolleyes:[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 13, 2008, 06:30:49 am[/size][hr]I find it hard to believe that no one on this forum knows the answer to this simple question, clearly I don't know it, so don't flame me for saying that I find it idiotic that not a single person with decency knows the answer. Pathetic.

item.title: .jar File
item.dc:creator: @kn0wntoowell kn0wntoowell
item.description:
@kn0wntoowell wrote:

I am trying to make my own client, and I understand everything perfectly fine. But how would I make it into a WORKABLE .jar file? I use the batch file
